result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Becki L Wachendorf

records.addlTxt: The motion to seal is not supported by law or otherwise justified.
Pre-trial conference on January 10, 2023 at 10:00 am.
Telephone conference on February 7, 2023 at 08:15 am.

1:04 PM Defendant Becki L Wachendorf not in court.  Attorney Allison J Borsheim in court for Becki L Wachendorf.  Attorney Jordan Lippert in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant was unavailable due to medical reasons. Attorney Borsheim requested a status hearing in 60-90 days for a follow up. State had no objection to a reset of the jury trial and a status conference. Court removed the jury trial. Suggested the parties have a pretrial in January with a status hearing in Feb. Counsel agreed. 1:09 PM
Pre-trial conference scheduled for January 10, 2023 at 10:00 am.
Telephone conference scheduled for February 7, 2023 at 08:15 am.

records.addlTxt: copy of discovery material filed by Atty Lippert to Atty Borsheim
Jury trial on November 22, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Plea date on October 28, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Pretrial Scheduling Order
The JA handled the call.  Atty Borsheim did not call in until 8:30 a.m. so did not participate in scheduling
Telephone scheduling conference on July 19, 2022 at 08:15 am.

3:30 pm  ADA Lippert appeared for State of Wisconsin by zoom, Attorney Borsheim appeared with defendant, Becki Wachendorf from Columbia County Jail by zoom.  No objection from either counsel to appearing by zoom today.  State calls Sgt Haueter-S&T.  Witness identifies DE.  Attorney Borsheim cross exams.  Atty Borsheim objects to bind over.  Court finds probable cause and binds DE over for trial.  Atty Borsheim is unable to view the Information that has been field but acknowledges that it does mirror the complaint, waives reading and stands mute.  DE advised of charge and penalty.  Court enters not guilty plea on DE's behalf.  State advises DE has new charges and believes a pre-trial would be beneficial.  Atty Borsheim agrees.  Court sets TSC on July 19,2022, at 8:15 am.  DE would not have to participate but is certainly free to,
Preliminary hearing on June 2, 2022 at 03:30 pm.

3:27 PM Prosecuting attorney Jordan Lippert in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Becki L Wachendorf not in court.  Attorney Allison J Borsheim in court for Becki L Wachendorf. Atty Borsheim states she has been in contact w/client, advised defendant appearances wasn't needed, State requested reset, matter to be reset for Preliminary Hearing by Zoom, 3:31 P.M.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 2, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
